heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 09 November 2025, with precipitation totalling 47.89mm.  The rain fell at 24.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 144.8 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 34.3mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025 when 47.89mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 24.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 02 February 2026 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 3 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.6.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 0 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (199°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 128.2 mph from 27 January 2026.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, drier conditions in rainfall (down 1.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 100 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 203 m) and inside temperature (up 2.0°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 100.2m lower than yesterday, 154.1m lower than the past week, 203.1m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 604m to 818m and averaged 582.7m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: Expect overcast skies with low cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, the air will feel dry and near calm conditions. A few light raindrops may fall, overcast skies with low cloud, and it’s dim outside. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
